headline.seo: McDonald’s Happy Meal to Get Healthier

docs.lead_paragraph: Bowing to pressure from health advocates and parents, McDonald’s will try to cut the calorie count of the Happy Meal by reducing the portion of French fries and adding fruit.
docs.snippet: Bowing to pressure from health advocates and parents, McDonald’s will try to cut the calorie count of the Happy Meal by reducing the portion of French fries and adding fruit.

headline.main: McDonald’s Alters Happy Meals and Shrinks Fries

docs.abstract: McDonald’s acknowledges that consumer and parental pressures forced it to lower the amount of fries in children’s meals, and add fruit.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bowing to pressure from antiobesity campaigns, McDonald’s is putting the Happy Meal on a diet.
docs.snippet: McDonald’s acknowledges that consumer and parental pressures forced it to lower the amount of fries in children’s meals, and add fruit.

headline.seo: ‘7 Things You Can Do to Fight Alzheimer’s’ Isn’t So Certain
headline.print_headline: Grasping for Any Way To Prevent Alzheimer’s
headline.main: Grasping for Any Way to Prevent Alzheimer’s

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have calculated that if people address certain risks, a significant number of Alzheimer’s cases could be prevented, with the operative word being “could.”
docs.snippet: Scientists have calculated that if people address certain risks, a significant number of Alzheimer’s cases could be prevented, with the operative word being “could.”

headline.main: Can You Lower Your Risk for Alzheimer’s?

docs.abstract: A study presented recently at the Alzheimer’s Association International Conference in Paris suggested that simple lifestyle changes might lower a person’s risk for developing dementia.
docs.lead_paragraph: A study presented recently at the Alzheimer’s Association International Conference in Paris suggested that simple lifestyle changes might lower a person’s risk for developing dementia.
docs.snippet: A study presented recently at the Alzheimer’s Association International Conference in Paris suggested that simple lifestyle changes might lower a person’s risk for developing dementia.

headline.sub: Justifying a Tax The Resulting Benefits
headline.main: Bad Food? Tax It, and Subsidize Vegetables

docs.lead_paragraph: Taxing junk food and making healthy food more affordable would save millions of lives and billions of dollars in health care costs.
docs.snippet: Taxing junk food and making healthy food more affordable would save millions of lives and billions of dollars in health care costs.

headline.main: Some Professors Are Promoting More Industry Ties

docs.abstract: A pro-industry group of researchers meet to talk about ways to engender more trust for their work, even if they're paid by device and drug companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of medical professors and researchers who take industry money -- and are really proud of it -- met in New York on Friday to sketch out plans to fight back against the opposition to conflicts of interest in medicine.
docs.snippet: A pro-industry group of researchers meet to talk about ways to engender more trust for their work, even if they're paid by device and drug companies.
